item.title: Bushes and trees overgrown, 6th August
item.description:
The bushes and trees all along the side of the school have become overgrown and are blocking the pathway. There is also a huge branch hanging across the pavement that looks ready to fall down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Valley Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter scattered, 6th August
item.description:
After collecting the rubbish, the cleaners leave the bags on the pavement overnight. Foxes tear them open and scatter the garbage. ^^^Please organise the cleanersâ€™ work so that the bags are not left outside overnight.^^^

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Boat Lifter Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daily dump of rubbish on the street, 6th August
item.description:
Multiple people report this rubbish being dumped on the street. Can you provide an escalation route so some action is taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on Lesnes Abbey bridge, 6th August
item.description:
There is graffiti all up the south stairwell, as well as some black text on the bridge exterior itself marked "velt" twice. It's been there for some time (over a couple of months). There's also a bit on the southeastern side on the bridge itself with black paint of some text marked "stren." Graffiti doesn't make our community look and feel nice so it would be lovely if we could have this fixed. :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Way, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Donation boxes broken in - clothes everwhere, 6th August
item.description:
Both the oxfam and electronics bins continue to be broken into. Clothes continue to be spread across the block. It is also a problem with hackney electronics box. I have sent an email to oxfam to ask them to remove the box.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Healthy tree removed, 6th August
item.description:
Yet another tree has been removed on Glanville Road. Apparently they have all been "unhealthy". No attempt has been made to save the trees. I ask again. How much is the company paid that removes these trees? Where are the reports on each tree which clearly show issues? This makes it 4 trees on just Glanville Road that have been removed. This is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glanville Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on the pavement, 6th August
item.description:
